text: I am Matt Poulos and I'm the founder and
CEO of Cognos and we are the makers of
the course match course registration
platform so what course match is is it's
a new way for students to register for
classes the way they do it is they list
all the classes that they want to take
and our algorithm will then give every
student a complete schedule that gives
them as many of the classes that they've
asked for as we'd be fair to their
classmates we're trying to make the
distribution of classes and schedules in
higher education fair and equal and
right now when you actually study
there's huge disparities certain
populations end up getting more of the
great classes others don't and for the
most part has been left as an unsolved
problems major innovations in the field
of market design in economics have
actually made it possible to solve this
and what's exciting about coursematch is
it's actually an implementation of those
solutions so we've taken the theory from
the academy and have solved that problem
in a lot of ways our company wouldn't be
possible without AWS to be able to solve
a problem of that sort of computational
complexity we have to spin up a ton of
parallel servers we need a huge
computational ability and so all of
those things when this theory was being
developed just weren't really available
anywhere else and so now we depend
heavily on AWS every day to actually be
able to run so it was a no-brainer for
us we use so many AWS services it's
every aspect of our company essentially
is tied to AWS in some way so our core
product its algorithm runs on do a
combination elastic beam stone we hold
our data with s3 or consumer-facing
stuff the domain routing just about any
aspect of our company runs through AWS
it's there's been a fantastic way to get
to understand the EdTech community we're
a small part of the startup ecosystem
and so being able to meet other people
doing creative things but still within
our space it's hugely powerful and we
find out that just a support from AWS
like it's evolved over time initially
was technical now it's a lot more about
our go-to-market and setting up
relationships and opportunities it
really it's it's about having a
community built around EdTech that
doesn't really exist any
[Music]
